title: These are perfect.
review_text: Customer rating: 5 out of 5 starsThese are perfect.Reviewed byAmazing- November 17, 2024These are awesome, the noise cancellation is great but the ability to go into transparency is amazing. Whenever things are to loud I can either silence it or make it so it’s not deafening while still hearing my surroundings. The seamless connecting, the ease of calls & controls just blows me away! Amazing to think about when I used to walk about with a MP3 player that used discs with some bad earphones. I’m 25 now and it’s amazing how good tech is becoming. These are testament!Quality:ExcellentValue:ExcellentEase of

title: Defective, don’t buy from best buy

title: Hearing Aid
review_text: Customer rating: 1 out of 5 starsHearing AidReviewed byDenny- February 27, 2025When I bought the Earbuds I was told that the software for the hearing aid feature was now available in Canada. When I went to set them up I found out that while the Canadian government had given approval, that there were still Provincial approvals required, and thus the software has not yet to be released in my part of Canada.Quality:PoorEase of Use:PoorNo,I would not recommend this to a friend.Helpful (8)Not helpful (3)Report

title: Find My AirPods Is Basically Useless
review_text: Customer rating: 2 out of 5 starsFind My AirPods Is Basically UselessReviewed byMatt- September 24, 2025I don’t get the hype around Apple’s Find My feature for AirPods. I’ve held the case up to my iPhone, opened the app, and even took the AirPods out while it was trying to find them — and it still said “looking for signal.” They were literally inches from the phone. It’s infuriating because the app gives you the impression it’ll actually help you locate them, but in real use it often does nothing. The case has a speaker, the AirPods are charged, everything’s working,

title: Find My AirPods Is Basically Useless
review_text: Customer rating: 2 out of 5 starsFind My AirPods Is Basically UselessReviewed byMatt- September 24, 2025I don’t get the hype around Apple’s Find My feature for AirPods. I’ve held the case up to my iPhone, opened the app, and even took the AirPods out while it was trying to find them — and it still said “looking for signal.” They were literally inches from the phone. It’s infuriating because the app gives you the impression it’ll actually help you locate them, but in real use it often does nothing.
